alert.note: Alert for Marion; Morrow (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marion and central Morrow Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Richwood, or 14 miles southwest of Marion, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Mount Gilead, Cardington, Prospect, Waldo, Caledonia, New Bloomington, Edison, Green Camp, Fulton and Iberia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central Ohio.
